item.title: 消息人士称，布鲁塞尔或将重新考虑对大众和宝马征收中国电动汽车进口关税的问题
item.description: 两位知情人士称，欧盟委员会已向大众和宝马发出信号，可能会考虑降低这两家汽车制造商进口中国产电动汽车的关税。【原文：The European Commission has signalled to Volkswagen and BMW that it may consider lowering tariffs on the two carmakers' imports of China-made EVs, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国 5 月商业库存增幅略高于预期
item.description: 由于批发商和零售商的库存大幅增加，5 月份美国商业库存的增幅略高于预期。【原文：U.S. business inventories increased slightly more than expected in May amid solid rises in stocks at wholesalers and retailers, a trend that could see inventory investment contributing to economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: Skechers 控告 LL Bean 抄袭鞋款设计
item.description: LL Bean 被鞋类制造商 Skechers USA 告上法庭，后者指控这家服装和户外用品公司非法抄袭其鞋类产品，而该公司的鞋类产品已售出数百万双。【原文：LL Bean has been sued by footwear maker Skechers USA , which accused the clothing and outdoor gear company of illegally copying its shoes, which have sold in the millions.】

item.title: Essilux 首席执行官表示，新款雷朋 Meta 眼镜的销量超过了旧款眼镜
item.description: EssilorLuxottica 首席执行官周二表示，Meta Platforms 和 EssilorLuxottica 的新一代智能眼镜在几个月内的销量超过了旧款眼镜两年的销量。【原文：Meta Platforms and EssilorLuxottica's new generation of smart glasses have sold more in a few months than the old ones did in two years, EssilorLuxottica's Chief Executive said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 券商嘉信理财第二季度利润因利息收入下降而下滑
item.description: 经纪公司嘉信理财第二季度利润下降 2%，原因是客户存款利息和自身借款利息增加。【原文：Brokerage Charles Schwab's second-quarter profit fell 2%, hurt by higher interest paid on client deposits and its own borrowings.】

item.title: 美国 6 月进口价格持平
item.description: 美国劳工统计局（Bureau of Labor Statistics）周二称，由于能源产品价格的下降抵消了食品成本的反弹，6月份美国进口价格保持不变。【原文：U.S. import prices were unchanged in June as lower prices for energy products offset a rebound in the cost of food, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 股市上涨，股票交易员助推美国银行盈利
item.description: 股票交易员在第二季度高歌猛进，推动了华尔街各家银行的盈利。【原文：Equity traders rode high in the second quarter, propelling earnings across Wall Street banks.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）首席经济学家：美国联邦储备委员会不急于降息
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）首席经济学家皮埃尔-奥利维耶-古林查斯（Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas）告诉路透社记者，通胀数据的降温使美联储开始 "非常合理地 "转向宽松利率，但美国劳动力市场依然强劲，这意味着不必急于做出决定。【原文：Cooling inflation data is allowing the Federal Reserve to begin a "very reasonable" shift toward easing rates, but a still-strong U.S. labor market means that there's no rush to make decisions, International Monetary Fund chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas told Reuters.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）认为全球经济增长稳定，警告通货紧缩势头放缓
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二表示，在美国经济活动降温、欧洲经济触底反弹以及中国消费和出口增强的背景下，全球经济将在未来两年实现小幅增长，但增长道路上的风险依然存在。【原文：The global economy is set for modest growth over the next two years amid cooling activity in the U.S., a bottoming-out in Europe and stronger consumption and exports for China, but risks to the path abound, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 菲利普莫里斯将在美国科罗拉多州新建工厂，扩大 Zyn 生产规模
item.description: 菲利普莫里斯国际公司（Philip Morris International）周二表示，将投资 6 亿美元在科罗拉多州开设一家生产厂，生产 Zyn 尼古丁袋，以帮助满足美国对传统烟草产品替代品的需求。【原文：Philip Morris International said on Tuesday it would invest $600 million to open a manufacturing facility in Colorado to produce its Zyn nicotine pouches to help meet demand for alternatives to traditional tobacco products in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国 6 月零售销售额持平，低于预期的微降
item.description: 美国 6 月份零售销售额持平，基本趋势强劲，这可能会提高第二季度的经济增长预期。【原文：U.S. retail sales were unchanged in June and the underlying trend was strong, which could boost economic growth estimates for the second quarter.】

item.title: 沃尔玛智利员工结束罢工
item.description: 沃尔玛智利工会周一晚间在社交媒体上表示，该工会已取消罢工，目前与公司的劳资协议将再延长 18 个月。【原文：Walmart's workers union in Chile has called off a strike, it said on social media on Monday evening, with its current labor agreement with the company extended another 18 months.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，美国联邦贸易委员会正在寻求亚马逊与人工智能初创公司Adept交易的细节
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的人士告诉路透社，美国联邦贸易委员会已要求亚马逊公司提供更多细节，说明其聘用人工智能初创公司Adept的高管和研究人员的交易。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has asked Amazon.com to provide more details on its deal to hire top executives and researchers from artificial intelligence startup Adept, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 国泰君安资产管理规模增长；因费用增加，收入超出预期
item.description: 国泰君安周二报告称，管理的客户资产增加，这有助于托管银行从服务中获得更多费用，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了 0.8%。【原文：State Street on Tuesday reported a rise in client assets under management which helped the custodian bank rake in more fees from the service, sending its shares up 0.8% in premarket trading.】

item.title: PNC Financial 第二季度利润因手续费收入增加而增长
item.description: 周二，PNC Financial 公布第二季度利润增长，原因是承销和交易咨询费用的增加帮助该银行抵消了利息收入的下降。【原文：PNC Financial reported an increase in second-quarter profit on Tuesday as higher fees from underwriting and advising on deals helped the bank offset a decline in interest income.】

item.title: SymphonyAI 目标 2025 年下半年上市，营收达到 5 亿美元
item.description: 美国人工智能公司 SymphonyAI 的首席执行官在接受采访时表示，该公司的产品可帮助百事可乐等公司预测需求，并帮助金融公司发现欺诈行为，该公司正准备在明年下半年上市。【原文：SymphonyAI, a U.S. artificial intelligence company whose products help the likes of Pepsi predict demand and financial companies spot fraud, is preparing to go public in the second half of next year, its chief executive said in an interview.】

item.title: 投资银行业务复苏，摩根士丹利利润大增
item.description: 摩根士丹利第二季度利润增长，原因是股票和债务承销业务强劲，投资银行活动反弹。【原文：Morgan Stanley's profit rose in the second quarter as investment banking activity rebounded on strength in equity and debt underwriting.】

item.title: 冷藏房地产投资信托基金 Lineage 计划在美国首次公开募股中筹集 38.5 亿美元资金
item.description: 冷藏巨头 Lineage 公司周二表示，它正寻求在美国首次公开募股中筹集高达 38.5 亿美元的资金。【原文：Cold storage giant Lineage said on Tuesday it is seeking to raise up to $3.85 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 英国监察机构开始调查微软雇佣 Inflection AI 前员工事件
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周二表示，已开始正式调查微软聘用 Inflection AI 公司部分前员工以及与该初创公司达成相关安排的行为。【原文：Britain's competition regulator has started a formal investigation into Microsoft's hiring of some former staff of Inflection AI and its entry into associated arrangements with the startup, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国银行利润因利息收入缩水而下降
item.description: 美国银行第二季度利润下降，原因是其贷款利息收入减少，并预留了更多资金以弥补潜在的信贷损失。【原文：Bank of America's profit fell in the second quarter as its income from interest on loans shrank and it set aside more money to cover potential credit losses.】

item.title: 莱昂纳多首席执行官：与泰雷兹、空中客车公司合作实现太空 "新战略愿景
item.description: 意大利航空航天与防务集团负责人周二表示，莱昂纳多公司正在与法国泰雷兹公司和空中客车公司合作，在太空领域实现 "新的战略愿景"。【原文：Leonardo is working with France's Thales and Airbus for a "new strategic vision" in the space sector, the head of the Italian aerospace and defence group said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称普华永道考虑将中国金融服务审计人员减半
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，普华永道（PwC）正在考虑裁减多达一半的中国金融服务审计人员，因为监管调查和客户外流使业务前景暗淡。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) is considering slashing up to half its financial services auditing staff in China, two people with knowledge of the matter said, as a regulatory investigation and an exodus of clients darken business prospects.】

item.title: 俄罗斯分裂后，前 Yandex 首席执行官沃罗兹携人工智能基础设施企业回归
item.description: 曾创建俄罗斯科技巨头 Yandex 的创始人 Arkady Volozh 告诉路透社，摆脱了与俄罗斯的联系，新成立的荷兰公司 Nebius 希望帮助引领建立人工智能基础设施的大潮。【原文：Freed from its ties to Russia, newly unveiled Dutch firm Nebius hopes to help lead the great drive to build the infrastructure underpinning artificial intelligence, founder Arkady Volozh, who previously set up Russian tech giant Yandex, told Reuters.】

item.title: 零售销售数据公布前期指走势平稳
item.description: 华尔街期货周二持稳，此前美国主要股指在上一交易日反弹，市场正在等待零售销售数据和一系列企业财报。【原文：Wall Street futures were steady on Tuesday after the main U.S. indexes rallied in the previous session, as markets awaited retail sales numbers and a bevy of corporate earnings.】

item.title: 购房者持谨慎态度，阿根廷僵尸房贷市场复兴之路任重道远
item.description: 在阿根廷，房地产经纪人给潜在购房者的一个重要建议是：带上现金，大包小包的现金。【原文：In Argentina, real estate agents have one key piece of advice for potential home buyers: bring cash, big bags of it.】

item.title: 联合健康（UnitedHealth）季度利润超预期，上调变革黑客成本
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）周二公布的第二季度利润好于预期，原因是其医疗保健服务部门表现强劲，并上调了与今年早些时候技术部门遭黑客攻击有关的成本预期。【原文：UnitedHealth Group reported a better-than-expected profit for the second quarter on Tuesday, due to strength in its healthcare services unit and raised the cost estimates tied to a hack at its tech unit earlier this year.】

item.title: 谷歌收购 "热门市场 "网络公司 Wiz 将加强云安全
item.description: 专家表示，如果 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌成功收购云安全公司 Wiz，这将加强其为黑客攻击热点--大型机构提供的云安全产品，并有助于谷歌与云计算竞争对手亚马逊和微软一较高下。【原文：If Alphabet's Google is successful in its effort to buy cloud security company Wiz, it would bolster its cloud security offerings for large organisations, a hotspot for hackers, and help it take on cloud rivals Amazon.com and Microsoft , experts said.】

item.title: 美国 鲍威尔激起加息希望，特朗普贸易降温
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 俄罗斯科技公司 Yandex 的前国际业务以 Nebius 集团的名义推出
item.description: 本周二，俄罗斯科技巨头 Yandex 的国际业务以 Nebius 集团的形式正式启动，该集团总部位于阿姆斯特丹，由 Yandex 前首席执行官 Arkady Volozh 领导。【原文：The international businesses of Russian technology giant Yandex , spun off in a $5.4-billion deal that was finalised this week, launched on Tuesday as Nebius Group, headquartered in Amsterdam and led by former Yandex CEO Arkady Volozh.】

item.title: 曾是印度最大初创企业的 Byju's 面临破产程序
item.description: 印度板球委员会投诉教育科技公司 Byju's 未能收回 1900 万美元的欠款后，印度一家法庭于周二启动了该公司的破产程序，使这家曾是印度最大初创企业的公司再次遭受打击。【原文：An Indian tribunal on Tuesday started insolvency proceedings for edtech firm Byju's after the country's cricket board complained about failure to recover $19 million in dues, dealing another blow to a company that was once India's biggest startup.】
